Title: Data Platform Specialist – Stage
HTML:
Società

Banca Mediolanum

Data Platform Specialist – Stage

Banca Mediolanum è un'organizzazione che ridefinisce il panorama finanziario con oltre tre decenni di innovazione. Attraverso le società che ne fanno parte, si dedica a fornire servizi finanziari, bancari e assicurativi su misura che rispondano alle esigenze uniche di ogni cliente.

La Banca si impegna a costruire relazioni durature basate sulla fiducia, trasparenza e sull'attenzione ai dettagli.

La nostra è una realtà dinamica, fondata su relazioni, responsabilità e libertà. La nostra cultura promuove la positività, la responsabilità e l’innovazione sostenibile.

Siamo convinti che il successo di un'azienda sia il risultato del successo individuale dei suoi membri. In Gruppo Mediolanum ti offriamo più di un lavoro: l'opportunità di contribuire a un cambiamento positivo e di crescere insieme a noi.

Per la Direzione ICT stiamo cercando una figura di Data Platform Specialist – Stage.

Nel team Data Platform e Business Intelligence la risorsa entrerà in stage e sarà responsabile delle seguenti attività:


  • Contribuire al team di sviluppo tecnologico e funzionale della Data Platform aziendale, in linea con i principi di Data Governance e Data Quality richiesti dalle normative del settore;
  • Collaborare all’analisi e alla documentazione dei requisiti funzionali per l’evoluzione delle soluzioni applicative del mondo dati, dalla raccolta (Data Injestion) alla presentazione (reporting, dashboarding e data-services);
  • Contribuire alle attività progettuali, dalla raccolta requisiti, all’analisi tecnico/funzionale, al supporto alla progettazione, sviluppo e roll out in produzione;
  • Interagire con gli utenti di business, con le altre funzioni interne alla Divisione ICT e con i fornitori esterni, coinvolti nelle attività;


Requisiti:


  • Lauree in Ingegneria, Informatica, Statistica o equivalente;
  • Conoscenza di base ed interesse per il settore bancario e assicurativo;
  • Familiarità con i requisiti normativi relativi ai temi di Data Governance (BCBS 239, Bankit 285, GDPR, ecc…);
  • Forte interesse per l’analisi dei dati e familiarità con le tematiche di Data Management (Glossario Business, Dizionario dei Dati, Data Lineage, Data Quality) e Data Analytics;
  • Buone capacità di problem solving, team working, comunicazione, proattività, attitudine analitica e attenzione e cura dei dettagli;
  • Conoscenza avanzata Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project), conoscenza di base di SQL e strumenti di BI;
  • Esperienza accademica o personale con linguaggi di programmazione per la gestione dei dati (Python, Spark, SQL);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti cloud (Azure è un plus);


Cosa offriamo:


  • Servizio navetta da/per Milano Famagosta (M2) / San Donato Milanese (M3);
  • Hybrid-work;
  • Formazione continua su tecnologie e metodologie avanzate nel campo della Data Platform e dell’Intelligenza Artificiale;
  • Possibilità di crescita professionale in un team innovativo e dinamico;
  • Coinvolgimento in progetti sfidanti, con impatto strategico per l'azienda;


Sede di lavoro:


  • Basiglio – Milano 3 City;


I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

E’ possibile visionare l’informativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.

Il Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion.

Verranno presi in considerazione solo i curricula in linea con i requisiti minimi richiesti.

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.



Data and Reporting Analyst


We report on the evolution of LOIM’s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM’s revenue processes and implement LOIM’s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM’s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE

  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports;
  • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting;
  • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development;
  • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts;
  • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources;


YOUR PROFILE

  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus;
  • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products;
  • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills;
  • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy;
  • Team player with good communication skills;
  • Very good written and spoken English and French;
  • Residence in Switzerland.



Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You’ll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description du poste :



CONTEXT:

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution



HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred 
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline




STARTING DATE: July 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)

LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Alten Groupe

En 30 ans, ALTEN est devenu le leader de l'ingénierie externalisée et des services informatiques aux entreprises. ALTEN, composé de 54 000 employés avec 88% d’ingénieurs, réalise des projets complexes et hautement techniques pour plus de 6 500 clients incluant les entreprises les plus prestigieuses de tous les secteurs de l'industrie, ainsi que des services et des télécommunications. Nous travaillons avec des acteurs clés des secteurs Aéronautique & Espace, Défense & Naval, Sécurité, Automobile, Ferroviaire, Energie, Sciences de la Vie, Finance, Distribution, Télécommunications et Services.

Alten Suisse

Depuis 2005, avec 450 collaborateurs, ALTEN Suisse est un partenaire de référence dans la fourniture de services d'ingénierie à 100 entreprises leaders mondiales. Les activités d'ALTEN Suisse couvrent l'ensemble des principaux domaines stratégiques du marché suisse dans les domaines des Sciences de la Vie, de l'Ingénierie et des Services IT.

Votre mission :

Identifier et extraire des données pertinentes à partir de sources variées, afin d’analyser les tendances et de calculer des indicateurs clés.
Nettoyer, structurer et intégrer les données pour qu’elles soient exploitables efficacement.
Concevoir des tableaux de bord interactifs, définir des KPIs et assurer le reporting pour offrir une vision claire et partagée des performances.
Mettre en place un processus structuré pour recueillir les besoins et demandes des parties prenantes.
Réaliser des analyses approfondies et fournir des recommandations éclairées à destination du management.
Assurer la gestion et l’accessibilité des outils d’analyse pour permettre aux décideurs et équipes internes de suivre l’évolution de leur activité.
Former et accompagner les utilisateurs dans l’interprétation et l’utilisation des indicateurs disponibles.
Fédérer les différents acteurs autour des enjeux liés aux données, animer les échanges, promouvoir l’amélioration continue et renforcer la culture data.
Effectuer une veille active sur les technologies et outils d’analyse de données pour intégrer les meilleures pratiques.

Profil recherché :

Titulaire d'un diplôme universitaire / ingénieur en science des données ou titre jugé équivalent.
Idéalement complémenté par une expérience professionnelle dans le domaine.
A l’aise avec les outils informatiques permettant de recueillir, traiter et publier des données.
Expérience en gestion de projets et en conduite du changement.
Excellente culture générale digitale.
Bon esprit d'équipe, alliant dynamisme et proactivité.
Aisance dans les contacts humains, la communication et le reporting.
Polyvalent et autonome, animé de curiosité et d'un bon esprit d'analyse.




Ce que nous vous offrons :

Chez Alten, nous vous offrons la sécurité d'un contrat permanent tout en vous donnant la liberté de travailler avec de nombreux clients prestigieux. Avec le luxe de disposer d'un large éventail de bureaux à travers le monde, nous sommes dans une position unique pour vous donner la liberté d'expérimenter des opportunités commerciales nationales et internationales. Ainsi, nous évoluons dans un marché hautement innovant, toujours à la pointe des dernières technologies, ce qui fait de vous un pionnier dans votre domaine.

C'est pourquoi nous proposons à nos employés des formations et des ateliers très recherchés, allant des compétences techniques aux compétences non techniques, et nous vous délivrons des certificats qui augmenteront vos qualifications, vous permettant ainsi de participer à des projets novateurs.

Postulez dès maintenant et participez à notre formidable aventure !

Show more

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: July 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe that this variety drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!
Show more

We believe that this variety drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!

Title: Business Insight Analyst
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.





Job Description



We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.



The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group’s digital assets.



The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.







The job in brief:



Job Title - Business Insight Analyst



Working model - Chiasso, hybrid



Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.



Level - Professional



Location - Chiasso



Contract - Permanent, full time (36 h/week)







What your impact will be



Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth


Qualifications



Your expertise:



1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis

Desirable:



Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry


Additional Information



Perks of working with us:



How we work together:



- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)



- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays



- Flexible start and end of the working day



- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations



How we learn together:



- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.



- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.



Other perks:



- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes



- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues



- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares



- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)



Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (10-30 minutes)



- 1st interview (Manager)



- Offline Tech test



- 2nd interview (Manager + team member): Test review



- Offer extended

(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)



Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re Hiring: Data Analyst (Remote – Based in Switzerland)

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive smarter decisions? We’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support data-driven strategies and uncover meaningful trends—all from a fully remote position based in Switzerland.

Location: Remote (Must be based in Switzerland)




What You’ll Do

• Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities

• Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and reporting needs

• Provide actionable insights to support product, marketing, finance, and operations

• Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across sources

• Support ad hoc analysis and decision-making with clear, data-backed recommendations




What We’re Looking For

• 2–4 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role

• Proficient in SQL, Excel/Google Sheets, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)

• Familiarity with Python or R is a strong plus

• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

• Excellent communication skills and ability to present data clearly to non-technical audiences

• Fluent in English; German or French is a plus

• Based in Switzerland and authorized to work remotely




Why Join Us

• 100% remote flexibility with a Switzerland-based team

• A data-driven culture that values insights and evidence-based decisions

• Opportunities to shape analytics strategy and influence key business outcomes

• Collaborative, curious, and growth-oriented team environment

Ready to make data work harder—and smarter? We’d love to hear from you.

#DataAnalyst #RemoteJobs #SwitzerlandJobs #HiringNow #DataDriven #BusinessIntelligence #AnalyticsCareers #WorkFromHome

Title: Circularity Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At Nespresso, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. We place our people at the heart of our success – all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.

Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Nespresso HQ

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

Start date: Mid-July 2025

Deadline for applications: May 19th

What We Offer At Nespresso

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!

Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change

The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world’s most trusted brands

Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Circularity Data Analyst Intern, you will support data collection and analysis related to material usage and waste generation in our operations. You will assist in identifying data sets, analyzing material flows, creating visualizations, and researching industry benchmarks. This internship provides valuable experience in sustainability practices and data analysis within a collaborative team.

A Day in the Life of a Circularity Data Analyst Intern


Assist in identifying and sourcing relevant data sets on material usage and waste generation within operations and factories.
Support data collection efforts by collaborating with team members to ensure accurate information.
Help analyze material flows to identify basic trends and patterns in usage and waste.
Create simple visualizations (charts, graphs) to present findings to the team.
Assist in proposing basic metrics for measuring circularity, such as material recovery rates.
Contribute to the process of updating and reporting on circularity metrics as needed.
Research industry benchmarks for circularity and summarize findings for team review.
Observe and learn about best practices from industry leaders to support improvement initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful


Student or fresh graduate in a Bachelor Master’s Degree in Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or Sustainability
Passion and interest in Sustainability
Strong analytical mind, comfortable with data, curious and autonomous
Excellent presentation skills as well as a methodical and rigorous approach to tasks
Ability to navigate challenges effectively while maintaining a proactive and positive attitude.
Consolidated experience on Sharepoint and PowerBi would be a plus as well as a solid experience with Excel
Fluent in French and advanced-level English proficiency


Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we’ve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you’ll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.

Title: Client Consulting Analyst, Visa Consulting and Analytics
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



What it's all about ...



Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful results for clients. Drawing on our expertise in consulting, data analytics, digital marketing and economics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.







Specific Responsibilities include:



Support a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients.



Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data with some guidance.



Conduct market research and data analysis to identify insights in the payment industry.



Support the development of client-specific presentations by adapting templates for unique client scenarios and needs.



Support senior consultants in developing and delivering high-quality advisory solutions to clients, such as business strategy, product development & pricing, customer segmentation and customer experience improvement.



This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (Tuesday - Thursday), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. 









Qualifications



What we'd like from you ...



Payment industry, digital payments or payment processing experience preferred.



Strategic and analytical thinking with a strong attention to detail that leverages multiple sources of information.



Able to understand and start to disaggregate problem statement into distinct pieces of analysis.



Use and adapt templates for unique client scenarios, optimizing structure to demonstrate + articulate key messages.



Ability to execute quantitative & qualitative analysis with some guidance.



Basic takeaways from the data + starting to craft storyline; ensure data quality + leverage data to support decision-making in project management.



Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts.



Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt.



Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools.



An interest in learning advanced analytics tools (SAS, R, Tableau, etc.).



An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus.



An affinity for payments technology, FinTech and digital.



• Fluent English and German, both written and spoken (C2 level minimum)





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Entry & Analysis
Description:
📌 Please Read Before Applying:

🔗 Apply directly via LinkedIn.

📞 Your LinkedIn profile must include a Swiss phone number so we can contact you.

⚠️ We are only considering candidates who live in Switzerland 🇨🇭.

💻 Data Entry & Analysis (Remote – Based in Switzerland)

Full-time | 100% Remote | Entry-Level Friendly

Are you organized, detail-focused, and comfortable working with numbers?

We are looking for a Data Entry & Analysis team member to help us keep our information clean, updated, and useful. This is a great opportunity to start or grow your career in data, business operations, or analysis.

You don’t need to be an expert — just someone who loves working with Excel, pays attention to details, and wants to learn.

📋 What You Will Do:
Enter and update information in spreadsheets, databases, or online tools
Check for errors and correct missing or incorrect data
Organize large amounts of data in a clear and logical way
Create simple reports or summaries (tables, charts)
Support other teams with data tasks when needed
Keep sensitive data safe and private
✅ You Are a Good Fit If You:
Live in Switzerland 🇨🇭
Have basic computer skills and are comfortable with Excel or Google Sheets
Are detail-oriented and careful with numbers
Can follow instructions and work independently
Understand basic English (written and spoken)
Want to learn more about working with data
🎁 What We Offer:
Remote work from anywhere in Switzerland
Friendly, supportive team and clear training
A stable, full-time job with simple, important tasks
Opportunity to learn and grow into more advanced roles
Swiss market salary 💼
Work-life balance and flexibility

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
80% - 100%

Nous allons réaliser ensemble

Dans le cadre de notre transformation digitale et de l’adoption d’une architecture Data Mesh, nous recherchons un·e Business Data Analyst passionné·e par la donnée et par la compréhension fine des enjeux métier. Vous serez le lien direct entre les équipes opérationnelles et les équipes techniques, en transformant les besoins métiers en cas d’usage data concrets et en accompagnant leur mise en œuvre au sein de notre plateforme de données moderne basée sur Microsoft Azure (Databricks, Fabric, Power BI, dbt).

Intégré·e à l’unité « Données et Innovation » (rattachée à la direction informatique de SIG), vous participerez activement à l’identification, la formalisation et la priorisation des cas d’usage, à la définition des modèles de données et à la conception des livrables.

La donnée est désormais au cœur de la transformation digitale de l’entreprise. Elle devient un actif stratégique à forte valeur ajoutée. Votre rôle sera de détecter cette valeur et de faciliter son exploitation par nos équipes métiers.

Vous êtes convaincu·e que la donnée est un levier de performance et d’innovation ? Vous souhaitez travailler au plus proche des métiers tout en collaborant avec des experts data et IT ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Votre énergie au service d’une Genève durable

En tant que Business Data Analyst, votre mission principale consiste à :


Analyse et cadrage des besoins métiers
Animer des ateliers de cadrage avec les équipes métiers (interviews, co-construction, Data/Event Storming, etc.) afin d’identifier les cas d’usage à forte valeur ajoutée et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles claires ;
Contribuer à la structuration des données métiers en lien avec les principes du Domain-Driven Design ;
Participer activement à la conception des couches Silver et Gold de l’architecture en médaillon, en lien avec les ingénieurs de données et les experts en modélisation de données.



Gouvernance et documentation métier
Formaliser et maintenir des glossaires, dictionnaires de données, référentiels métier et autres artefacts favorisant une compréhension partagée des données ;
Contribuer à la qualité des données, en collaborant à la mise en place de tests de validation et à la définition de data contracts entre producteurs et consommateurs ;
Accompagner les équipes dans la conformité réglementaire et participer à la documentation et à la classification des données ;
Promouvoir une culture data partagée au sein de l’entreprise.



Interface entre métiers et data platform
Traduire les besoins métier en spécifications exploitables pour les équipes data et IT ;
Participer aux choix d’outils, de modèles et de bonnes pratiques pour renforcer l’intégration des usages métiers dans la plateforme de données SIG.

Votre personnalité et vos compétences

Techniques et méthodologiques


Bonne compréhension des principes du Domain-Driven Design (DDD) et capacité à collaborer avec les équipes métiers et data pour identifier les événements clés (via des ateliers tels que Data/Event Storming) ;
Maîtrise des fondamentaux de la modélisation analytique (ex. modèles en étoile, data marts) et bonne culture générale des architectures de données de type Data Mesh ;
Capacité à formaliser des data contracts pour structurer les échanges entre producteurs et consommateurs de données ;
Sensibilité à la qualité des données et participation à la définition de règles de validation fonctionnelles (data tests) ;
Connaissance des environnements Azure, Databricks, Fabric ou des outils de datavisualisation (Power BI), sans besoin de développement technique avancé.


Outils et méthodes


Capacité à produire ou relire des modèles UML ou logiques pour s'assurer de la cohérence entre les besoins métiers et les solutions mises en œuvre.


Qualités personnelles et relationnelles


Excellentes capacités d’analyse, de synthèse et de vulgarisation ;
Aisance dans l’animation de groupes de travail, la conduite d’interviews ou d’ateliers métiers :
Forte orientation client et esprit collaboratif pour faire le lien entre métiers, IT et gouvernance ;
Rigueur, autonomie, sens du détail et curiosité, avec une volonté constante de faire progresser les pratiques data ;
Capacité à accompagner le changement grâce à une communication claire, pédagogique et structurée.


Votre parcours académique

Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire, EPF ou équivalent en informatique, systèmes d’information, data science, ingénierie ou gestion, avec une expérience confirmée dans l’analyse de besoins métiers liés à la donnée.

Vous avez déjà œuvré en tant que Business Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire, en lien direct avec les utilisateurs métiers et les équipes data/techniques, dans des projets où la donnée est un levier de transformation. Vous êtes à l’aise dans des environnements complexes et en évolution, et savez faire preuve de curiosité, d’adaptabilité et d’autonomie.

Une connaissance des architectures de type Data Mesh, des principes de gouvernance data, ou une sensibilité aux enjeux du secteur de l’énergie constitue un véritable atout.

Rejoindre SIG, c’est participer au changement !

SIG est une entreprise publique de proximité au service de la population, des entreprises et des collectivités publiques genevoises. Elle fournit un large panel de prestations dans la distribution des énergies, de l’eau et de la valorisation des déchets. Elle s'engage, en tant que bras industriel de l'Etat de Genève, en faveur d'une transition écologique ambitieuse.

SIG favorise l’équilibre entre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle par plus de flexibilité dans les horaires, les taux d’activité et les espaces de travail. Convaincue que les différences sont une force, SIG adopte une politique de recrutement visant à promouvoir la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de ses équipes.

Mise au concours n° 7597

Délai de postulation

26 mai 2025

Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company’s endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‘Line of Sight’ between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Employee Status

Intern/Co-op (Fixed Term)

Relocation

No relocation

VISA Sponsorship

No

Travel Requirements

No Travel Required

Flexible Work Arrangements

Not Applicable

Shift

Not Indicated

Valid Driving License

Requisition ID R348035

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations




My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master’s graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.




Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.




The Role:

Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
📌 Antes de postular, por favor ten en cuenta:

🔗 Postula directamente a través de LinkedIn.

📞 Tu perfil debe incluir un número de teléfono suizo para poder contactarte.

⚠️ Solo consideramos candidaturas de personas que vivan actualmente en Suiza 🇨🇭.

📊 Business Intelligence Analyst (Remoto – Desde Suiza)

Full-time | 100% Remoto | Datos que impulsan decisiones

Sabes que los datos son más que números. Son patrones, oportunidades, y, sobre todo, decisiones esperando ser tomadas.

Buscamos un/a Business Intelligence Analyst que transforme datos dispersos en ideas claras y accionables, para ayudarnos a tomar decisiones más inteligentes en producto, marketing y operaciones.

Este rol es perfecto si te apasiona encontrar respuestas donde otros ven confusión.

🧠 Lo que harás:
Recopilar, estructurar y analizar datos de distintas áreas del negocio (ventas, clientes, producto, marketing)
Diseñar dashboards interactivos en herramientas como Power BI, Tableau o Looker
Identificar patrones, anomalías y oportunidades de optimización
Apoyar al equipo directivo con reportes semanales, mensuales y ad hoc
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para traducir insights en acciones concretas
Proponer mejoras en procesos de recopilación, limpieza y visualización de datos
Ayudar a construir una cultura basada en datos en toda la organización
✅ Perfil ideal:
2–4 años de experiencia como analista de datos, BI o similar
Dominio de herramientas como Power BI, Google Data Studio, Tableau, SQL y Excel
Conocimiento básico de Python, R o Google Sheets (automations) es un plus
Capacidad analítica, pensamiento estructurado y atención al detalle
Buen nivel de comunicación (oral y escrita) para explicar resultados de forma clara
Fluidez en inglés (obligatorio); otros idiomas europeos son una ventaja
Residencia actual en Suiza 🇨🇭
🎁 Qué ofrecemos:
Trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier lugar de Suiza
Proyectos reales donde tu análisis tendrá impacto directo
Equipo ágil, respetuoso y orientado a resultados
Flexibilidad horaria y autonomía
Salario competitivo suizo 💼
Oportunidades de crecimiento hacia roles más senior o estratégicos

Full-time | 100% Remoto | Datos que impulsan decisiones

Sabes que los datos son más que números. Son patrones, oportunidades, y, sobre todo, decisiones esperando ser tomadas.

Buscamos un/a Business Intelligence Analyst que transforme datos dispersos en ideas claras y accionables, para ayudarnos a tomar decisiones más inteligentes en producto, marketing y operaciones.

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Stagiaire - BI Analyst - 6 mois
Description:
Job Description

Vous êtes actuellement en cours de formation dans une université/haute école dans le domaine Informatique / Finance et recherchez un stage pour valider votre cursus (avec convention de stage).

MISSIONS



Concevoir et développer des dashboards interactifs sur Power BI afin d’optimiser le suivi de l’activité.
Automatiser des workflows et optimiser les flux de données via des solutions no-code.
Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de portefeuille pour comprendre leurs besoins en reporting et en analyse.
Assurer la qualité des données et l’ergonomie des interfaces développées.



PROFIL



Vous êtes actuellement étudiant(e) en Informatique, Data Science, Finance, ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
Capacité à comprendre les enjeux financiers et à traduire les besoins métiers en solutions BI.
Maîtrise de Power BI : création de tableaux de bord, DAX, gestion des sources de données.
Sens du design et de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI).
La connaissance de Power Apps est un plus.
Une expérience (stage, projets scolaires/personnels) dans un domaine similaire est requise.
Autonomie, rigueur et esprit analytique.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.

Vos missions principales :


Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions


Qualifications


Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark
Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI


Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :


La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
Un restaurant d’entreprise
Une LPP avantageuse


Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.
Show more

  • Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI

Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :

  • La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
  • 5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
  • Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
  • La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une LPP avantageuse

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit




Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pflegewegweiser – Essentielle Entlastung für pflegende Angehörige

Pflegewegweiser entlastet pflegende Angehörige schnell und spürbar – in einem System, das oft langsam reagiert. Warten ist für uns keine Option.

Was uns ausmacht: Wir liefern aussergewöhnlich gute Hilfe für Familien – schnell, persönlich und wirksam. Geschwindigkeit ist unser Werkzeug, radikaler Fokus unser Antrieb. Wir erhöhen Standards konsequent, streichen alles Unnötige und vereinfachen das Wesentliche. Dabei handeln wir unternehmerisch: mutig, pragmatisch und lösungsorientiert und genau das erwarten wir auch von Dir.

Wenn du beim Lesen innerlich denkst: Let’s go – schneller, besser, weiter, dann bist du bei uns richtig.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Optimierung von SQL-Abfragen in Databricks zur Erstellung täglicher Reports und Forecasts
Analyse operativer Spitex-Daten zur Erkennung von Trends, Engpässen und Optimierungspotenzialen
Automatisierung von Datenprozessen mit Python
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Management, Pflegeleitung und Tech-Team
Kontinuierliche Steigerung der Betreuungs- und Prozessqualität durch datenbasierte Transparenz und Fokus auf das Wesentliche


Fachliche Anforderungen


Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Databricks SQL oder vergleichbaren Plattformen
Fundierte Python-Skills, insbesondere für Datenanalyse & Automatisierung
Grundverständnis relationaler Datenbanken und Umgang mit strukturierten Daten
Erste Erfahrung mit Daten (Beruf, Studium, Projekte) – auch motivierte Berufseinsteiger*innen willkommen
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Zeitreihen, Forecasting oder KPI-Tracking
Gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1) sowie grundlegende Englischkenntnisse zur Verständigung mit weiteren Abteilungen


Was Dich Erwartet


Eine sinnstiftende Aufgabe mit echtem gesellschaftlichem Impact
Ein Team mit Tempo, Fokus und Umsetzungskraft
„Speed is King“ – Kultur statt Bürokratie
Verantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum


Ready für Tempo mit Sinn?

Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung!
Show more
HTML:
Pflegewegweiser – Essentielle Entlastung für pflegende Angehörige

Pflegewegweiser entlastet pflegende Angehörige schnell und spürbar – in einem System, das oft langsam reagiert. Warten ist für uns keine Option.

Was uns ausmacht: Wir liefern aussergewöhnlich gute Hilfe für Familien – schnell, persönlich und wirksam. Geschwindigkeit ist unser Werkzeug, radikaler Fokus unser Antrieb. Wir erhöhen Standards konsequent, streichen alles Unnötige und vereinfachen das Wesentliche. Dabei handeln wir unternehmerisch: mutig, pragmatisch und lösungsorientiert und genau das erwarten wir auch von Dir.

Wenn du beim Lesen innerlich denkst: Let’s go – schneller, besser, weiter, dann bist du bei uns richtig.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Entwicklung und Optimierung von SQL-Abfragen in Databricks zur Erstellung täglicher Reports und Forecasts
  • Analyse operativer Spitex-Daten zur Erkennung von Trends, Engpässen und Optimierungspotenzialen
  • Automatisierung von Datenprozessen mit Python
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Management, Pflegeleitung und Tech-Team
  • Kontinuierliche Steigerung der Betreuungs- und Prozessqualität durch datenbasierte Transparenz und Fokus auf das Wesentliche

Fachliche Anforderungen

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Databricks SQL oder vergleichbaren Plattformen
  • Fundierte Python-Skills, insbesondere für Datenanalyse & Automatisierung
  • Grundverständnis relationaler Datenbanken und Umgang mit strukturierten Daten
  • Erste Erfahrung mit Daten (Beruf, Studium, Projekte) – auch motivierte Berufseinsteiger*innen willkommen
  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Zeitreihen, Forecasting oder KPI-Tracking
  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1) sowie grundlegende Englischkenntnisse zur Verständigung mit weiteren Abteilungen

Was Dich Erwartet

  • Eine sinnstiftende Aufgabe mit echtem gesellschaftlichem Impact
  • Ein Team mit Tempo, Fokus und Umsetzungskraft
  • „Speed is King“ – Kultur statt Bürokratie
  • Verantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum

Ready für Tempo mit Sinn?

Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects…) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master’s or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Show more
