Title: Data Analyst Intern at Operations Performance Management & Development (limited 3-12 months, 40-100%, all genders)
Description:
Operations Performance Management & Development is right at the heart of SWISS’ operations, contributing every day to insights-based decision making and continuous performance improvements of our airline operations. This is a unique opportunity to gain experience not only data analysis, but also airline operations.

Starting date: July 01, 2025, or upon agreement.

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating an impact with tangible business improvements? Then join our SWISS Operations Performance Management & Development team and apply your data skills to actual business challenges shaping SWISS’ journey towards a truly data-driven company!

As a Data Analyst Intern you take a front-seat role in advising SWISS’ operations management. You will support running data projects, ad-hoc analysis, and have the chance to get a glimpse of how we use and enhance the operational data landscape of a global airline.


Provide valuable data-driven insights supporting decision-making within SWISS’ Operations & Steering team
Create data visualizations, reporting, and interactive dashboards
Create insightful analysis to help quantifying key drivers to optimize SWISS’ operational performance
Contribute to our operational data landscape & support automation
Foster data democratization and self-service capabilities across the company
Collaborate and effectively communicate data insights across various stakeholders from SWISS Operations departments


Benefits


Company health management
Discounts
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Flight benefits
Subsidized parking or public transport
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Employee and networking events


Requirements


Workload Specification: For this position, a 100% workload is preferred
Data science and/or data engineering background is an advantage
HF diploma, Bachelor’s, Master’s students or graduates (HF diploma & Bachelor’s students must have completed at least three semesters) in an analytical subject, e.g., data science, engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related fields
Knowledge in SQL coding, good command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
Ability to work independently, yet a team-player with strong communication, and social skills
Excellent oral and written presentation skills; competences in analysis and management presentations
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint, and Excel
Fluent knowledge of English is required; knowledge of German will be an additional asset


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Marius Gisler

recruiting.services@swiss.com


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Warehouse Consultant
Description:
Position Title: BI & DWH Specialist

Functional Area: Information Technology

Reporting to: Director - IT

Location: Lugano ( On-Site )

Job Description:

As a BI & DWH Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Oracle data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Warehouse Design and Development:
Design and implement a robust data warehouse architecture.
Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.




Business Intelligence Development:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
Data Governance:
Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
📌 Antes de postular, por favor ten en cuenta:

🔗 Postula directamente a través de LinkedIn.

📞 Asegúrate de que tu perfil incluya un número de teléfono suizo para facilitar el contacto.

⚠️ Solo se considerarán personas que residan actualmente en Suiza 🇨🇭.

📈 Quantitative Analyst (Remoto – Desde Suiza)

Full-time | 100% Remoto | Data-Driven Decision Support

¿Tienes la mente de un científico y el enfoque de un estratega?

Buscamos un/a Quantitative Analyst con pasión por los datos, la estadística y la construcción de modelos que traduzcan números en decisiones sólidas. Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con equipos de negocio, finanzas o producto, desarrollando análisis avanzados que impulsan nuestras estrategias.

Ideal si te gusta trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos, resolver problemas complejos y construir modelos predictivos con impacto real.

🧮 Responsabilidades:
Recopilar y analizar datos estructurados y no estructurados desde múltiples fuentes
Desarrollar modelos cuantitativos para simulaciones, predicción o análisis de riesgo
Automatizar procesos analíticos y generar reportes técnicos claros
Validar hipótesis de negocio mediante métodos estadísticos y econométricos
Presentar resultados de forma comprensible para stakeholders no técnicos
Colaborar con equipos de BI, finanzas, estrategia o producto
Aplicar técnicas como regresión, optimización, machine learning supervisado, etc.
✅ Perfil deseado:
2–4 años de experiencia en análisis cuantitativo, modelado estadístico o data science aplicado
Formación en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física, Economía Cuantitativa o similar
Dominio de Python, R o MATLAB para análisis numérico
Experiencia con SQL y bases de datos relacionales
Sólidos conocimientos en estadística, teoría de probabilidad y técnicas de modelado
Nivel avanzado de inglés (escrito y oral); otros idiomas son bienvenidos
Residencia actual en Suiza 🇨🇭
🎁 ¿Qué ofrecemos?
Trabajo 100% remoto desde Suiza 🏡
Proyectos desafiantes en los que tus modelos realmente se aplican
Equipo técnico, colaborativo y con foco en precisión
Oportunidades de aprendizaje continuo y desarrollo profesional
Horarios flexibles y autonomía real
Compensación competitiva en el contexto suizo 💼

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineering Intern in Zürich, where you will have the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals and contribute to innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this internship, you will gain hands-on experience with modern data technologies and help set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

What to Expect in Your First 6 Months

Month 1-2


Get familiar with Sika’s data architecture, technology stack, and main data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign).
Shadow team members to understand daily workflows and best practices in data engineering.
Support the team with basic data extraction, data entry, and documentation tasks.
Get certified in different technologies such as Azure, Databricks and dbt.


Month 3-4


Learn to use key data engineering tools such as Azure Databricks, dbt, and Azure Data Factory through guided tutorials and hands-on exercises.
Assist in maintaining and updating simple ETL/ELT pipelines under supervision.
Help monitor data quality and perform basic data validation checks.


Month 5-onwards


Support teammates in preparing data for analytics and reporting use cases.
Help create and update documentation, templates, and user guides for data processes.
Participate in troubleshooting sessions and learn how to resolve common data pipeline issues.
Continue to build your skills by attending internal workshops and collaborating on small-scale data projects with guidance from mentors.


Qualifications


Recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or a related field; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Strong interest in data engineering and analytics; relevant coursework or project experience is a plus.
Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL and Python; knowledge of PySpark or dbt is an advantage.
Interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory); prior experience is a plus but not required.
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub is a plus.
Eager to learn about domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information

To find out what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to receiving your direct online application.
Show more

  • Help monitor data quality and perform basic data validation checks.

Month 5-onwards

  • Support teammates in preparing data for analytics and reporting use cases.
  • Help create and update documentation, templates, and user guides for data processes.
  • Participate in troubleshooting sessions and learn how to resolve common data pipeline issues.
  • Continue to build your skills by attending internal workshops and collaborating on small-scale data projects with guidance from mentors.

Qualifications

  • Recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or a related field; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Strong interest in data engineering and analytics; relevant coursework or project experience is a plus.
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL and Python; knowledge of PySpark or dbt is an advantage.
  • Interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory); prior experience is a plus but not required.
  • Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub is a plus.
  • Eager to learn about domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information

To find out what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to receiving your direct online application.

Title: Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente (w/m/d) 80% - 100%
Description:
Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente (w/m/d)

Arbeitspensum: 80% - 100% / Arbeitsort: Rotkreuz

Jetzt bewerbenWas ist dir bei der Arbeit wichtig? Mitgestaltung? Selbstverwirklichung? Sinn? Ausgleich? Herausforderung? Das alles bekommst du bei Mobility. Denn bei uns heisst es nicht Arbeit, sondern: MORK – more than just work. Als Pionierin des Carsharings haben wir Erfahrung mit «Welt verändern». Willst du die Verkehrswende in der Schweiz und den Weg von Mobility mitgestalten? Dann bewirb dich auf diese neugeschaffene Stelle als Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente und stärke Mobility mit deinem Antrieb.

Deine Aufgaben


Du bist im Bereich Kundensegmente für den Aufbau und die Weiterentwicklung von Kundennutzungs- und Performanceanalysen zuständig.
Du erkennst und analysierst Muster in der Nutzung und entwickelst einen algorithmischen Zuteilungsraster in Kundensegmente anhand erkannter Merkmale (z.B. Nutzungsvorlieben, demografische Merkmale etc.).
Du entwickelst Methoden und Instrumente zur Abbildung von Kennzahlen, Trends und Prognosen in Zusammenhang mit den Kundensegmenten.
Du erstellst (Entscheidungs-) Grundlagen für die Entwicklung und Optimierung von Massnahmen (z.B. Kampagnen, Usability- oder Produktanpassungen etc.) zur zielgerichteten Bearbeitung der Kundschaft.
Du schaffst die Grundlagen zum Monitoring der Wirksamkeit einzelner Massnahmen (Measure – Learn).
Du verantwortest die datenorientierten Analysen und Monitorings des Produkt-Kunden-Fits und Integration der Erkenntnisse in Methoden und Prognosen.
Du unterstützt in der Analyse der aktuellen und zukünftigen Mobilitätsbedürfnisse in der Schweiz.
Du arbeitest eng mit dem Team Data Analytics zusammen.


Das bringst du mit


Du bringst mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit, idealerweise im Mobilitätsbereich, Verkehr und/oder im Segmentmanagement / Kundendatenanalyse.
Du verfügst über eine höhere Ausbildung auf Stufe Fachhochschule oder Hochschule mit Schwerpunkt im Bereich Datenanalyse oder Produktmanagement oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung.
Du bist neugierig in die Bedürfnisse von aktuellen und zukünftigen Kund:innen einzutauchen Expert:in für Wissen über Mobilitys Kundschaft zu werden und somit einen Beitrag zur nachhaltigen Mobilitätszukunft zu leisten.
Du erkennst Nutzungs- und Kundenpotenziale, hast einen stilsicheren Umgang mit internen und externen Daten inkl. Kenntnisse von Datenquellen sowie der Kombination von mehreren Datenquellen.
Wenn du Erfahrungen mit Geodatenanalyse mitbringst, ist das von Vorteil.


&quotMobility entstand vor über 25 Jahren mit viel Innovationskraft. Heute kannst du in der Abteilung Produkte und Kundensegmente dazu beitragen, dass die nach wie vor aktuelle Idee von Carsharing sich weiterentwickelt. Die vielfältigen Kundenbedürfnisse und digitalen Anforderungen bringen dabei stets spannende Herausforderungen mit sich.&quotSeraina Marti, Teamleiterin Produkt Management

Wir bieten

Beteiligung am Unternehmensgewinn, an den ÖV-Reisekosten, Übernahme des Handy-Abos, die Nutzung vom Carsharing zu vorteilhaften PreisenBeitrag zu einer nachhaltigen und sinnstiftenden Geschäftsvision leisten und eigene Ideen aktiv einbringen5 Wochen Ferien, bis zu 16 bezahlte Feiertage, 16 Wochen Mutterschafts- und bis zu 4 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub als auch hervorragende SozialversicherungsleistungenFlexwork: eigenständige Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort, 40-Stundenwoche bei einem 100% Pensum – entsprechende Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, auch dank TeilzeitarbeitMobility als Arbeitgeberin

Durch Wertschätzung und Respekt geprägt – das ist Mobility als Arbeitgeberin. Dabei sind unsere Mitarbeitenden unsere Kernkompetenz, welche wir aktiv fordern und fördern. Wir stellen hohe Anforderungen und unterstützen individuell mit gezielten Massnahmen, damit die täglichen Herausforderungen eigenverantwortlich und engagiert erledigt werden können. Mitunter trägt die einzigartige Unternehmenskultur ihren Teil dazu bei, dass Mitarbeitende mit Freude ihre Arbeit verrichten. Lass dich vom Mobility-Spirit überzeugen und leiste deinen Teil zu einer sinnstiftenden Geschäftsidee. Begeistert und neugierig auf mehr?

Bei Fragen helfe ich gerne weiter.

Chantal Notz,

Human Resources

Title: BI Analyst (m/w) 100%
Description:
Die Avosano Gruppe ist ein Schweizer Unternehmen und positioniert sich in den Bereichen Pharmagrosshandel und Pharma-Prewholesale mit effizienten, qualitativ hochstehenden und innovativen Services entlang der Pharma Supply Chain in der gesamten Schweiz. Die Avosano Gruppe beschäftigt mit den zwei Tochterunternehmen Avosano AG (Pharmagrosshandel) und Avosano Industrie Service AG (Pharma-Prewholesale) an 3 Standorten insgesamt 750 Mitarbeitende.

Für unsere Abteilung Controlling am Standort Niederbipp/Romanshorn suchen wir eine/n Mitarbeiter/in als

BI Analyst (m/w) 100%

Die Herausforderungen, denen du dich stellen wirst


Aufbau und Automatisierung / Standardisierung regelmässiger Reports, Dashboards sowie Erstellung von Ad hoc Auswertungen für den Einkauf, das Controlling sowie für das Management
Entwicklung und Betreuung von BI – Lösungen mittels MS Power BI / Tableau
Datenmodellierung und -Aufbereitung aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen (u.a. ERP, BI)
Erstellung und Optimierung von SQL-Datenabfragen
Analyse und Überwachung von Kennzahlen sowie Erarbeitung von Handlungsempfehlungen bei Zielabweichungen
Unterstützung bei Prozessoptimierungen sowie bei den finanziellen Planungsprozessen
Eigenständige Mitarbeit zur Verbesserung / Weiterentwicklung unseres BI Umfeldes / der Controlling Instrumente (u.a. Automatisierung, Performante Ladeketten)
Überwachung der Datenqualität


Was dich von anderen unterscheidet


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaft oder Informatik / Wirtschaftsinformatik
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im BI Umfeld
Fundierte Kenntnisse in MS Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Datenmodellierung
Sicherer Umgang mit ERP Systemen (SAP)
Strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Kommunikationsstärke sowie hohe Eigenverantwortung


Warum du dich uns anschliessen solltest


Ein spannendes Arbeitsumfeld mit herausfordernden Aufgaben und grosser Verantwortung
Viel Gestaltungsfreiheit und Mitwirkung in einer dynamischen und zukunftsorientierten Branche
Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen mit fairen Leistungen
Ein engagiertes Management, das auf aktive Mitarbeit und Mitgestaltung durch das Team setzt
Show more

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Data
Description:
Help build the world’s most advanced multimodal dataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset, spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond, will power the training of the world’s most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance, and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience.

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:


Are passionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities.


Responsibilities


Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.
Embody our culture and values.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
OR equivalent experience.
Experience using data processing technologies for Multimodal dataset scalability, parellel processing, data handling, streaming/batch processing, etc.
Experience working with distributed computing tools such as; Spark, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, Flink and Pyspark.
Experience conducted research in Machine Learning or worked as an ML Engineer/ MLOps/ SWE.
Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.


Preferred


Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
Show more

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

  • Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.




Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:

  • Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
  • Drive to learn new topics and master them
  • Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
  • Consulting and Communication Skills:
  • Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
  • Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
  • Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.


Technical design:

  • Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
  • Technical expertise:
  • First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
  • Familiarity with SQL and Python.


Language Proficiency:

  • Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.


Industry Experience:

  • First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
  • Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.


Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

Requisition ID:17116

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Poste : Data Analyst

📍 Localisation : Bienne

⏳ Taux d'activité : 100%

🗓️ Début : Dès que possible




Descriptif




L’un de nos clients recherche un data analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale est d'exploiter et interpréter les données pour en dégager des observations utiles afin d’orienter les stratégies des différents secteurs. Pour cela, il va créer et administrer les modèles de données ainsi qu’en assurer la mise à jour régulière automatique.




Responsabilités




Sélectionner et extraire des données pertinentes et de qualité provenant de sources diverses pour en calculer des tendances et indicateurs.
Traiter, nettoyer et intégrer des données pour les rendre exploitables.
Créer des dashboards, mettre en place des KPIs et du reporting pour donner une vision cohérente des résultats aux différentes équipes.
Mettre en place un processus afin de recueillir les sollicitations externes.
Produire des analyses robustes et des recommandations au management.
Gérer les outils d’analyses pour que les décideurs / les clients internes puissent suivre l’évolution de leur service.
Accompagner et former les utilisateurs sur la consultation et l’interprétation des indicateurs mis à disposition.
Coordonner les acteurs autour des données et indicateurs, animer les échanges, encourager l'amélioration continue et développer notre culture Data.
Réaliser la veille technologique autour des nouveaux outils visant à améliorer l’analyse des données.




Compétences techniques :




Langages de programmation : Python, Java/JavaScript, C#, VBA,..
Logiciels informatiques : Tableau, DesktopPrep, SAP,...




Profil




Titulaire d'un diplôme universitaire / ingénieur en science des données ou titre jugé équivalent.
Idéalement complémenté par une expérience professionnelle dans le domaine.
A l’aise avec les outils informatiques permettant de recueillir, traiter et publier des données.
Expérience en gestion de projets et en conduite du changement.
Excellente culture générale digitale.




Bon esprit d'équipe, alliant dynamisme et proactivité.
Aisance dans les contacts humains, la communication et le reporting.
Polyvalent et autonome, animé de curiosité et d'un bon esprit d'analyse.







------------------------------------------------------------------




Qui Sommes-nous?




Créée en 2007, Antaes est une société suisse de conseil en management et technologie classée dans le top 10 des sociétés de conseil en Suisse. Nous comptons plus de 300 ingénieurs expérimentés qui partagent notre passion.




Présents en Suisse, à Singapour, à Hong-Kong et en France, nous accompagnons nos clients suisses, et internationaux en intervenant dans les domaines suivants :

Conseil en organisation et transformation
Ingénierie Industrielle
Management des systèmes d'Information




En rejoignant nos équipes vous découvrirez :

Une équipe dynamique dans un esprit start-up
Un accompagnement humain et un suivi de l’évolution de votre carrière
Des challenges pour contribuer au développement de votre réseau
Des événements : team building, meet-up, workshop, Winter Event …
Une entreprise certifiée @HappyAtWork et ayant une politique RSE engagée (médaille d’or Ecovadis2023)

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

Requisition ID:17116

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, We Develop And Maintain Various Platforms In Order To Better Serve The Scientific Community. Please Find Here-below a List Of Our Main Platforms

https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Statistician
Description:
Statistician

3 Month contract

Part time

Hybrid - Neuchâtel




We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Statistician to lead the development and execution of a Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) for a retrospective study. The role involves extracting relevant data from an established registry and performing predefined analyses according to the SAP. This includes descriptive statistics, survival analysis, comorbidity scoring, and regression modeling.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop a Statistical Analysis Plans (SAP) in alignment with the study protocol.
Extract and prepare data from a pre-existing patient registry for analysis.
Conduct descriptive analyses
Develop and apply multivariable regression models and conduct sub-group analyses as specified in the SAP.
Ensure quality control of extracted data and analytical outputs.
Present and interpret results for internal and external stakeholders, and contribute to scientific publications.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Experience working with retrospective study designs.
Demonstrated ability to write and implement Statistical Analysis Plans.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R, SAS, or Stata.
Strong knowledge of survival analysis, regression modeling, and epidemiological measures (incidence and prevalence).
Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.




If you are interested please apply or send your CV to luke.sandilands@cpl.com

Show more

  • Extract and prepare data from a pre-existing patient registry for analysis.
  • Conduct descriptive analyses
  • Develop and apply multivariable regression models and conduct sub-group analyses as specified in the SAP.
  • Ensure quality control of extracted data and analytical outputs.
  • Present and interpret results for internal and external stakeholders, and contribute to scientific publications.


Qualifications:

  • Master’s or PhD in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related field.
  • Experience working with retrospective study designs.
  • Demonstrated ability to write and implement Statistical Analysis Plans.
  • Proficiency in statistical software such as R, SAS, or Stata.
  • Strong knowledge of survival analysis, regression modeling, and epidemiological measures (incidence and prevalence).
  • Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.


If you are interested please apply or send your CV to luke.sandilands@cpl.com

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.
Show more

Title: Stage Stage Business - Data Analyst
Description:
Convention de stage obligatoire - Niv Master

Ce que nous allons réaliser ensemble

Rejoindre SIG au sein de la Direction Smart City c’est avoir accès à une vue transverse sur divers projets d’ingénierie et d’innovation liés à la ville intelligente. Nous vous proposons la mission de stage suivante :


Proposer des solutions pour améliorer la qualité des données (vérification, nettoyage, normalisation);
Contribuer à la mise en place des contrôles de qualité des données, en s'assurant de leur conformité avec les règles métier ;
Proposer et mettre en place des indicateurs de performance stratégiques et opérationnels ;
Participer à développer et optimiser des tableaux de bord pour le suivi de performance et l’optimisation des processus décisionnels ;
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et améliorer les méthodes d'analyse ;
Contribuer à la base de connaissance Données et Reporting.


Ce que tu apportes

Tu suis actuellement un cursus universitaire ou équivalence dans le domaine informatique spécialisation « Business/ Data Analyst », Niveau Master.

Tu possèdes :


Un bon esprit de synthèse et d’analyse ;
Un intérêt pour apporter des solutions pour contribuer à la transition énergétique ;
De l’aisance relationnelle et des compétences à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe ;
Une personnalité dotée d'esprit d'initiative.


Tu maîtrises :


Les outils informatiques de manière générale ;
Les outils de transformation de la donnée et de visualisation ;
Des connaissances de base en gestion de bases de données (SQL, Excel, VBA) et modélisation de données et des bonnes connaissances en visualisation de données (Power BI) ;
Un intérêt pour la qualité des données et leur impact sur la prise de décision
De l’aisance relationnelle et des compétences à travailler de manière autonome tout en ayant un esprit d'équipe ;
Une personnalité dotée d'esprit d'initiative ;
Un intérêt marqué pour les services publics et le secteur de l'énergie et/ou secteur commercial serait un atout.


Ta mission :


Fiabilisation des données métier et sensibilisation des utilisateurs
Diagnostiquer l’état actuel des données et identifier les principales problématiques.
Réaliser le Design du modèle sémantique selon les standards définis par SIG.
Mettre en place un système de saisie des données.
Mettre en place des contrôles qualité pour fiabiliser les données.
Définir des standards et bonnes pratiques pour assurer la pérennité des données exploitées.



Développement de reporting, tableaux de bord décisionnel
Concevoir des tableaux de bord Power BI
Automatiser les rapports clés pour faciliter l’accès aux insights
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour s’assurer que les indicateurs développés répondent aux attentes stratégiques



Accompagnement des équipes métiers et montée en maturité analytique
Former et sensibiliser les équipes métiers et décisionnaires à l’exploitation des outils analytiques
Documenter les processus mis en place pour assurer une continuité après la mission



Livrables attendus
Tableaux de bord Power BI pour le suivi métier
Recommandations d’amélioration des processus basés sur la data
Plan de formation et documentation des bonnes pratiques

Merci de nous adresser une candidature en français.

Rejoindre SIG, c’est participer au changement !

SIG est une entreprise publique de proximité au service de la population, des entreprises et des collectivités publiques genevoises. Elle fournit un large panel de prestations dans la distribution des énergies, de l’eau et de la valorisation des déchets. Elle s'engage, en tant que bras industriel de l'Etat de Genève, en faveur d'une transition écologique ambitieuse.

SIG favorise l’équilibre entre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle par plus de flexibilité dans les horaires, les taux d’activité et les espaces de travail. Convaincue que les différences sont une force, SIG adopte une politique de recrutement visant à promouvoir la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de ses équipes.

Délai de postulation

21 mai 2025

Title: Quantitative Data Professional (f/m)
HTML:
ONE Agency | IT Recruitment Experts

Quantitative Data Professional (f/m)About our client

Our client is a leading alternative investment specialist with USD 50 billion in assets under management and more than 400 institutional clients in 33 countries. An international team of over 350 professionals is responsible for managing a wide range of investment programs focusing on private markets, liquid alternatives and multi-asset class solutions. Headquartered in Pfaeffikon (SZ), Switzerland, the firm has offices in New York, Dublin, London, Vaduz, Dubai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Sydney.

Your responsibilities

  • Build quantitative analysis and forecasting tools;
  • Perform statistical analyses on financial time-series data;
  • Develop proprietary predictive models using machine learning;
  • Automate standard business processes;
  • Implement scalable solutions and solve large-scale computational tasks;
  • Active collaboration and communication with all departments of our firm.

Your profile

  • University degree (master's degree or higher) in quantitative finance;
  • International mind-set, up to speed with recent global trends in data analytics;
  • Excellent programming skills (C, C++ and Java) and knowledge of database design;
  • Experience with machine learning and data science platforms such as kaggle;
  • Analytic approach, creativity, and focus on details; Enjoy working in an international, focused and dedicated team;
  • High degree of self-motivation.

Your chance

Interested? Please do not hesitate to find out more about this unique opportunity and send your complete application file to jobs@oneagency.ch.

Job ID: 606 | direct Link

Settore: Altro

Ruolo: Altro

Title: (Senior) Consultant SAP BI & Analytics (all genders)
Description:
Let’s power your future together




Vom Business Case zur Verwirklichung Deiner Ideen: Als führendes Beratungsunternehmen für strategische Transformationen sind wir vertrauenswürdiger Partner für unsere Kunden - und für unsere Mitarbeitenden. Verantwortungsvoll, leistungsstark und immer mit dem Menschen im Fokus. #WeAreWavestone Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Realisierung Deiner persönlichen Vision. Denn wir glauben an Mitarbeiter:innen, die etwas erreichen wollen und mit Leidenschaft an ihrem fachlichen Schwerpunkt und ihrer persönlichen Weiterentwicklung arbeiten. Als globales Unternehmen bieten wir Dir ein dynamisches, diverses Umfeld mit echtem Interesse an Deinen Zielen und einer Vielzahl an Möglichkeiten, um Deine Herzensthemen voranzutreiben. Willst auch Du gemeinsam mit uns wachsen? Dann werde Teil von Wavestone als (Senior) Consultant SAP BI & Analytics.




Deine Aufgaben




Als festes Projektmitglied unterstützt Du unsere Kunden in den Bereichen Data Strategy, Data Architecture, Data Intelligence, Big Data, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für kleinere Projekte und bist für die Konzeption und Umsetzung von datengetriebenen SAP Anwendungen verantwortlich
Du bist sowohl intern als auch extern beim Kunden Ansprechpartner:in für Data-Intelligence-Themen im Allgemeinen und SAP-Themen im Speziellen
Du führst neue Kolleg:innen in die Themen Data Intelligence, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence ein
Du unterstützt Deine:n Manager:in bei der Weiterentwicklung des Data Intelligence Portfolios
Du arbeitest bei der Erstellung und Präsentation von Angeboten mit




Dein Profil




Du verfügst über erste Projekterfahrung im SAP BI Frontend und/oder Backend
Dabei konntest Du Dich bereits als (Teil-) Projektleiter:in beweisen
Du bringst sehr gute Kenntnisse im Anforderungsmanagement für datengetriebene Lösungen mit
Du begeisterst Dich für innovative Data-Intelligence-Themen im SAP-Umfeld und hast Dich idealerweise bereits mit SAP BW on HANA, SAP BW/4HANA, HANA native, XS Advanced, S/4HANA Embedded Analytics, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Analysis for Office (AfO) oder SQL-Scripting auseinandergesetzt
Du zeichnest Dich durch sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten aus
Du hast Spass am Networking und ein enger Austausch mit Deinen Kunden ist dir wichtig
Stilsichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Deine Benefits




Your career, your way: Unser Personal Growth Model und Coaching & Leading-Ansatz bieten Dir eine enge, vollumfängliche Unterstützung sowohl in Deiner langfristigen Entwicklung als auch im Daily Business. In unserer Academy findest Du ein breites Weiterbildungsangebot wie Sprach- und Zertifizierungskurse, individuelles Coaching oder gezielte Trainings für Führungskräfte. Und durch unser flexibles Karrieremodell sowie unseren Fluid Company Ansatz entscheidest Du selbst, wo und wie schnell es für Dich weiter geht.
Karriere & Privatleben: Für eine gute Balance versuchen wir, alle unsere Stellen möglichst auch in Teilzeit anzubieten. Dank Mobile Work Policy arbeitest Du bequem von zuhause oder in einem unserer Schweizer Büros. Mit „Mobile Work Abroad“ kannst Du bis zu 50 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland (sowie UK, NOR, ISL, LIE) arbeiten, wenn Dein:e Kund:in Dich nicht vor Ort braucht. Des Weiteren gibt es 25 Tage Ferien, zusätzliche Ferientage bei besonderen familiären Umständen oder einem beruflich bedingten Umzug sowie verschiedene Sabbatical-Optionen.
Mobilität nach Mass: Dank eines festen monatlichen Mobilitätsbudgets bist Du bei uns flexibel und umweltbewusst unterwegs: egal, ob privat oder beruflich, und mit einem klaren Fokus auf nachhaltige Verkehrsmittel.
Wert-volle Unternehmenskultur: Unsere Werte verantwortungsbewusst, energiegeladen und gemeinsam sind zentrale Bestandteile unseres Alltags. Das spürst Du z. B. bei unseren Powerdays, bei denen Du Dich gemeinnützig engagieren kannst. In Netzwerken, wie dem Women’s Network oder unserer Mindfulness Gilde. Durch regelmässige Befragungen unserer Mitarbeitenden über Great Place To Work. Bei unseren einmaligen Events, firmeninternen Fitnessgruppen und vielem mehr.
Faire Vergütung: Wir bieten faire und attraktive Gehälter, bestehend aus einem fixen und einem leistungsbasierten Anteil. Im Falle von Mutterschutz gewähren wir dabei den vollen, leistungsbasierten Anteil. Zudem gleichen wir unsere Gehälter regelmässig über externe Benchmark Studien mit dem Markt ab – immer auch mit Blick auf Gender Equal Pay.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform’s scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

  • Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.



Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Business Analyst/ Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making. 

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

How You Can Make An Impact


Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent



What We Are Looking For:

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently



Consulting and Communication Skills:


Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops



Technical Expertise:


Strong Engineering and/or Mathematics background
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Title: Consultant - Forensic Technology and eDiscovery
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (“AI”) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity


The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (“GenAI”), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.


Your Key Responsibilities


Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have


Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and “can-do” approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you’ll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
