Title: Analyste données gestion infrastructures junior (H/F) 80-100% - CDD 12 mois
Description:
Actif.ve.s en Suisse occidentale, nous aidons nos client.e.s à réaliser leurs projets en fournissant des solutions énergétiques globales, efficaces et durables, qu’il s’agisse de production et de distribution d’électricité et de chaleur, d’installations électriques, de domotique, de mobilité douce, de climatisation ou de traitement de l’eau. Employeur exemplaire, nous soutenons le développement des compétences de nos 2600 collaborateurs.trice.s, dont 245 apprenti.e.s, ainsi que la conciliation entre vie privée et professionnelle.

La Direction Energie électrique exploite les infrastructures de production hydrauliques et thermiques, développe des installations de production à partir d’énergies renouvelables et assure un approvisionnement en électricité aux meilleures conditions.

Mission:


Création de rapports (Excel et PowerBI)
Récolte des besoins
Extraction de données
Mise en forme de données pour les besoins du rapport
Création de résumé de rapport avec tableau et graphiques dynamiques.
Ajout de visualisations
Sélection et épuration de données d’infrastructures de production d’énergie
Identification des données selon les besoins du rapport


Profil:


Formation en informatique, complétée par une expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la gestion de données 
Bonnes connaissances de PowerBI
Connaissances approfondies d’Excel (en anglais) : formules, pivot, modèle de données, Power Query 
Aisance avec les transformations de données et connaissances de base sur les principes de bases de données (MS SQL) ;
Maitrise courante écrite et orale en français avec de bonnes connaissances d’écoute et lecture techniques en anglais (autoformation, recherches, etc.); l’allemand est un plus.
Esprit d’analyse et de synthèse et personnalité curieuse et autodidacte ;
Des connaissances de Microsoft Dynamics souhaitées


Ce que nous vous offrons :


Acquisition d’expériences dans l’analyse de données dans un domaine divers et intéressant
Acquisition de nouvelles compétences et connaissances dans des techniques et produits utilisés dans le domaine d’analyse de données
Un environnement favorable à l’équilibre entre la vie professionnelle et privée
Les prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne, une équité de traitement, des possibilités de développement professionnel
Un fort esprit de cohésion et une équipe fière de collaborer : « Ensemble, nous avançons vers la réussite »


Besoin de renseignements complémentaires ?

Contactez Thierry Janssens, Analyste de données infrastructures au +41 26 352 65 69.

Intéressé.e ? Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre dossier de candidature complet en cliquant sur le bouton "Postuler" ci-dessous.

Ressources Humaines

Delia Cosereanu

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Show more

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Intern
Description:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Profil du candidat

Your profile:


Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more
HTML:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

 TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
  • Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
  • Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
  • Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
  • In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.


Profil du candidat

Your profile:

  • Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.


Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit




Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pflegewegweiser – Essentielle Entlastung für pflegende Angehörige

Pflegewegweiser entlastet pflegende Angehörige schnell und spürbar – in einem System, das oft langsam reagiert. Warten ist für uns keine Option.

Was uns ausmacht: Wir liefern aussergewöhnlich gute Hilfe für Familien – schnell, persönlich und wirksam. Geschwindigkeit ist unser Werkzeug, radikaler Fokus unser Antrieb. Wir erhöhen Standards konsequent, streichen alles Unnötige und vereinfachen das Wesentliche. Dabei handeln wir unternehmerisch: mutig, pragmatisch und lösungsorientiert und genau das erwarten wir auch von Dir.

Wenn du beim Lesen innerlich denkst: Let’s go – schneller, besser, weiter, dann bist du bei uns richtig.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Optimierung von SQL-Abfragen in Databricks zur Erstellung täglicher Reports und Forecasts
Analyse operativer Spitex-Daten zur Erkennung von Trends, Engpässen und Optimierungspotenzialen
Automatisierung von Datenprozessen mit Python
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Management, Pflegeleitung und Tech-Team
Kontinuierliche Steigerung der Betreuungs- und Prozessqualität durch datenbasierte Transparenz und Fokus auf das Wesentliche


Fachliche Anforderungen


Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Databricks SQL oder vergleichbaren Plattformen
Fundierte Python-Skills, insbesondere für Datenanalyse & Automatisierung
Grundverständnis relationaler Datenbanken und Umgang mit strukturierten Daten
Erste Erfahrung mit Daten (Beruf, Studium, Projekte) – auch motivierte Berufseinsteiger*innen willkommen
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Zeitreihen, Forecasting oder KPI-Tracking
Gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1) sowie grundlegende Englischkenntnisse zur Verständigung mit weiteren Abteilungen


Was Dich Erwartet


Eine sinnstiftende Aufgabe mit echtem gesellschaftlichem Impact
Ein Team mit Tempo, Fokus und Umsetzungskraft
„Speed is King“ – Kultur statt Bürokratie
Verantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum


Ready für Tempo mit Sinn?

Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects…) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master’s or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern at Operations Performance Management & Development (limited 3-12 months, 40-100%, all genders)
Description:
Operations Performance Management & Development is right at the heart of SWISS’ operations, contributing every day to insights-based decision making and continuous performance improvements of our airline operations. This is a unique opportunity to gain experience not only data analysis, but also airline operations.

Starting date: July 01, 2025, or upon agreement.

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating an impact with tangible business improvements? Then join our SWISS Operations Performance Management & Development team and apply your data skills to actual business challenges shaping SWISS’ journey towards a truly data-driven company!

As a Data Analyst Intern you take a front-seat role in advising SWISS’ operations management. You will support running data projects, ad-hoc analysis, and have the chance to get a glimpse of how we use and enhance the operational data landscape of a global airline.


Provide valuable data-driven insights supporting decision-making within SWISS’ Operations & Steering team
Create data visualizations, reporting, and interactive dashboards
Create insightful analysis to help quantifying key drivers to optimize SWISS’ operational performance
Contribute to our operational data landscape & support automation
Foster data democratization and self-service capabilities across the company
Collaborate and effectively communicate data insights across various stakeholders from SWISS Operations departments


Benefits


Company health management
Discounts
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Flight benefits
Subsidized parking or public transport
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Employee and networking events


Requirements


Workload Specification: For this position, a 100% workload is preferred
Data science and/or data engineering background is an advantage
HF diploma, Bachelor’s, Master’s students or graduates (HF diploma & Bachelor’s students must have completed at least three semesters) in an analytical subject, e.g., data science, engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related fields
Knowledge in SQL coding, good command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
Ability to work independently, yet a team-player with strong communication, and social skills
Excellent oral and written presentation skills; competences in analysis and management presentations
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint, and Excel
Fluent knowledge of English is required; knowledge of German will be an additional asset


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Marius Gisler

recruiting.services@swiss.com


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Warehouse Consultant
Description:
Position Title: BI & DWH Specialist

Functional Area: Information Technology

Reporting to: Director - IT

Location: Lugano ( On-Site )

Job Description:

As a BI & DWH Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Oracle data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Warehouse Design and Development:
Design and implement a robust data warehouse architecture.
Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.




Business Intelligence Development:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
Data Governance:
Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

  • Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
  • Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
  • Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
  • Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
  • Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
  • Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
  • Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.


  • Business Intelligence Development:
  • Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
  • Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
  • Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
  • Data Analysis and Reporting:
  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
  • Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
  • Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
  • Data Governance:
  • Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
  • Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
  • Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
  • 6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
  • Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID:17116

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.
Show more

Title: Stage Stage Business - Data Analyst
Description:
Convention de stage obligatoire - Niv Master

Ce que nous allons réaliser ensemble

Rejoindre SIG au sein de la Direction Smart City c’est avoir accès à une vue transverse sur divers projets d’ingénierie et d’innovation liés à la ville intelligente. Nous vous proposons la mission de stage suivante :


Proposer des solutions pour améliorer la qualité des données (vérification, nettoyage, normalisation);
Contribuer à la mise en place des contrôles de qualité des données, en s'assurant de leur conformité avec les règles métier ;
Proposer et mettre en place des indicateurs de performance stratégiques et opérationnels ;
Participer à développer et optimiser des tableaux de bord pour le suivi de performance et l’optimisation des processus décisionnels ;
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et améliorer les méthodes d'analyse ;
Contribuer à la base de connaissance Données et Reporting.


Ce que tu apportes

Tu suis actuellement un cursus universitaire ou équivalence dans le domaine informatique spécialisation « Business/ Data Analyst », Niveau Master.

Tu possèdes :


Un bon esprit de synthèse et d’analyse ;
Un intérêt pour apporter des solutions pour contribuer à la transition énergétique ;
De l’aisance relationnelle et des compétences à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe ;
Une personnalité dotée d'esprit d'initiative.


Tu maîtrises :


Les outils informatiques de manière générale ;
Les outils de transformation de la donnée et de visualisation ;
Des connaissances de base en gestion de bases de données (SQL, Excel, VBA) et modélisation de données et des bonnes connaissances en visualisation de données (Power BI) ;
Un intérêt pour la qualité des données et leur impact sur la prise de décision
De l’aisance relationnelle et des compétences à travailler de manière autonome tout en ayant un esprit d'équipe ;
Une personnalité dotée d'esprit d'initiative ;
Un intérêt marqué pour les services publics et le secteur de l'énergie et/ou secteur commercial serait un atout.


Ta mission :


Fiabilisation des données métier et sensibilisation des utilisateurs
Diagnostiquer l’état actuel des données et identifier les principales problématiques.
Réaliser le Design du modèle sémantique selon les standards définis par SIG.
Mettre en place un système de saisie des données.
Mettre en place des contrôles qualité pour fiabiliser les données.
Définir des standards et bonnes pratiques pour assurer la pérennité des données exploitées.



Développement de reporting, tableaux de bord décisionnel
Concevoir des tableaux de bord Power BI
Automatiser les rapports clés pour faciliter l’accès aux insights
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour s’assurer que les indicateurs développés répondent aux attentes stratégiques



Accompagnement des équipes métiers et montée en maturité analytique
Former et sensibiliser les équipes métiers et décisionnaires à l’exploitation des outils analytiques
Documenter les processus mis en place pour assurer une continuité après la mission



Livrables attendus
Tableaux de bord Power BI pour le suivi métier
Recommandations d’amélioration des processus basés sur la data
Plan de formation et documentation des bonnes pratiques

Merci de nous adresser une candidature en français.

Rejoindre SIG, c’est participer au changement !

SIG est une entreprise publique de proximité au service de la population, des entreprises et des collectivités publiques genevoises. Elle fournit un large panel de prestations dans la distribution des énergies, de l’eau et de la valorisation des déchets. Elle s'engage, en tant que bras industriel de l'Etat de Genève, en faveur d'une transition écologique ambitieuse.

SIG favorise l’équilibre entre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle par plus de flexibilité dans les horaires, les taux d’activité et les espaces de travail. Convaincue que les différences sont une force, SIG adopte une politique de recrutement visant à promouvoir la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de ses équipes.

Délai de postulation

21 mai 2025

Title: Quantitative Data Professional (f/m)
HTML:
ONE Agency | IT Recruitment Experts

Quantitative Data Professional (f/m)About our client

Our client is a leading alternative investment specialist with USD 50 billion in assets under management and more than 400 institutional clients in 33 countries. An international team of over 350 professionals is responsible for managing a wide range of investment programs focusing on private markets, liquid alternatives and multi-asset class solutions. Headquartered in Pfaeffikon (SZ), Switzerland, the firm has offices in New York, Dublin, London, Vaduz, Dubai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Sydney.

Your responsibilities

  • Build quantitative analysis and forecasting tools;
  • Perform statistical analyses on financial time-series data;
  • Develop proprietary predictive models using machine learning;
  • Automate standard business processes;
  • Implement scalable solutions and solve large-scale computational tasks;
  • Active collaboration and communication with all departments of our firm.

Your profile

  • University degree (master's degree or higher) in quantitative finance;
  • International mind-set, up to speed with recent global trends in data analytics;
  • Excellent programming skills (C, C++ and Java) and knowledge of database design;
  • Experience with machine learning and data science platforms such as kaggle;
  • Analytic approach, creativity, and focus on details; Enjoy working in an international, focused and dedicated team;
  • High degree of self-motivation.

Your chance

Interested? Please do not hesitate to find out more about this unique opportunity and send your complete application file to jobs@oneagency.ch.

Job ID: 606 | direct Link

Settore: Altro

Ruolo: Altro

Title: Stagiaire Data Science & ML Ops (h/f) 100% - temporaire 6 mois
Description:
Tu souhaites rejoindre une équipe au cœur de la transformation digitale par la donnée et l’IA ? Intègre l'équipe Advanced Analytics, au sein du secteur Strategy & Data Analytics, dont la mission est de concevoir des solutions concrètes et innovantes en combinant analytique avancée, machine learning et intelligence artificielle générative (GenAI). Si tu es passionné(e) par la data, l’IA et les technologies émergentes, et que tu souhaites contribuer à une transformation digitale ambitieuse dans une équipe dynamique et diversifiée, rejoins-nous !

TA MISSION


Tu analyses des données concrètes liées au secteur de l’assurance-maladie pour en extraire des insights à forte valeur ajoutée
En contribuant activement aux thématiques clés de l’équipe, telles que la détection de fraudes et d’erreurs, la mise en place d'un chatbot basé sur des technologies IA, l’optimisation de l’efficience opérationnelle via des modèles prédictifs ou génératifs, et les analyses clients pour mieux comprendre les besoins et comportements, tu joues un rôle essentiel
Tu participes à la préparation, au traitement et à la visualisation des données (nettoyage, transformation, dashboards) Aider à la conception et au déploiement de modèles de machine learning dans un cadre structuré (ML Ops, automatisation, monitoring) fait partie de tes responsabilités
En coopérant avec les équipes data, IT et métiers, tu relis les enjeux business aux solutions data
Tu développes tes compétences techniques (Python, SQL, ML), mais aussi méthodologiques et relationnelles, en évoluant dans un environnement collaboratif et stimulant


Tes qualités


Tu maîtrises le français (C1)
Tu as des bases en programmation et data science : Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), IDE, Git et SQL te sont familiers
Manipuler des données, les visualiser et appliquer des techniques de machine learning, c'est ton terrain de jeu
Autonome et proactif(ve), tu es prêt(e) à apprendre et à construire une carrière dans la donnée
Tu sais comprendre un enjeu métier et y répondre avec des solutions orientées données
Ton esprit d’équipe et ton goût pour le travail collaboratif font de toi un(e) collègue idéal(e)


Ta formation


Tu es étudiant(e) en cours de Bachelor ou de Master, ou récemment diplômé(e) dans un domaine tel que l’informatique, les systèmes de communication, la data science, ou équivalent


Pour nous rejoindre


Partage-nous ton parcours avec ton CV et tu peux volontiers y ajouter quelques mots pour nous parler de toi et de tes motivations


Fonction : Temporaire

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!
Show more
HTML:
Tu souhaites rejoindre une équipe au cœur de la transformation digitale par la donnée et l’IA ? Intègre l'équipe Advanced Analytics, au sein du secteur Strategy & Data Analytics, dont la mission est de concevoir des solutions concrètes et innovantes en combinant analytique avancée, machine learning et intelligence artificielle générative (GenAI). Si tu es passionné(e) par la data, l’IA et les technologies émergentes, et que tu souhaites contribuer à une transformation digitale ambitieuse dans une équipe dynamique et diversifiée, rejoins-nous !

TA MISSION

  • Tu analyses des données concrètes liées au secteur de l’assurance-maladie pour en extraire des insights à forte valeur ajoutée
  • En contribuant activement aux thématiques clés de l’équipe, telles que la détection de fraudes et d’erreurs, la mise en place d'un chatbot basé sur des technologies IA, l’optimisation de l’efficience opérationnelle via des modèles prédictifs ou génératifs, et les analyses clients pour mieux comprendre les besoins et comportements, tu joues un rôle essentiel
  • Tu participes à la préparation, au traitement et à la visualisation des données (nettoyage, transformation, dashboards) Aider à la conception et au déploiement de modèles de machine learning dans un cadre structuré (ML Ops, automatisation, monitoring) fait partie de tes responsabilités
  • En coopérant avec les équipes data, IT et métiers, tu relis les enjeux business aux solutions data
  • Tu développes tes compétences techniques (Python, SQL, ML), mais aussi méthodologiques et relationnelles, en évoluant dans un environnement collaboratif et stimulant

Tes qualités

  • Tu maîtrises le français (C1)
  • Tu as des bases en programmation et data science : Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), IDE, Git et SQL te sont familiers
  • Manipuler des données, les visualiser et appliquer des techniques de machine learning, c'est ton terrain de jeu
  • Autonome et proactif(ve), tu es prêt(e) à apprendre et à construire une carrière dans la donnée
  • Tu sais comprendre un enjeu métier et y répondre avec des solutions orientées données
  • Ton esprit d’équipe et ton goût pour le travail collaboratif font de toi un(e) collègue idéal(e)

Ta formation

  • Tu es étudiant(e) en cours de Bachelor ou de Master, ou récemment diplômé(e) dans un domaine tel que l’informatique, les systèmes de communication, la data science, ou équivalent

Pour nous rejoindre

  • Partage-nous ton parcours avec ton CV et tu peux volontiers y ajouter quelques mots pour nous parler de toi et de tes motivations

Fonction : Temporaire

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!

Title: SQL Database Engineer
Description:
Für unseren Kunden aus der Versicherungsbranche in Zürich, suchen wir eine:n erfahrene:n und aufgeschlossene:n




SQL Database Engineer




Ihre Aufgaben:




Betreiben eines Operational Data Storages (ODS), in welchem die Daten für die zentrale Verwaltungsapplikation (Web) bereitgestellt werden
Betreiben von ETL-Strecken und Stored Procedures, welche die Daten ins ODS laden
Umsetzen von fachlichen Anforderung und lösen von Bugs
Unterstützung von Projektvorgaben im Bereich Daten




Ihr Profil:




SQL Database Engineer mit sehr guten Kenntnissen in Microsoft SQL Server
Knowhow mit ETL Framework und Datentransformationen in Stored Procedures
Profunde Kenntnisse in SQL und T-SQL
BVG Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil
Sehr gutes technisches Verständnis vom SQL Server und eine überdurchschnittliche Fähigkeit, komplexe Zusammenhänge zu verstehen und Lösungen daraus abzuleiten
Selbständige Arbeitsweise und hohes Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse

Show more

Title: (Senior) Consultant SAP BI & Analytics (all genders)
Description:
Let’s power your future together




Vom Business Case zur Verwirklichung Deiner Ideen: Als führendes Beratungsunternehmen für strategische Transformationen sind wir vertrauenswürdiger Partner für unsere Kunden - und für unsere Mitarbeitenden. Verantwortungsvoll, leistungsstark und immer mit dem Menschen im Fokus. #WeAreWavestone Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Realisierung Deiner persönlichen Vision. Denn wir glauben an Mitarbeiter:innen, die etwas erreichen wollen und mit Leidenschaft an ihrem fachlichen Schwerpunkt und ihrer persönlichen Weiterentwicklung arbeiten. Als globales Unternehmen bieten wir Dir ein dynamisches, diverses Umfeld mit echtem Interesse an Deinen Zielen und einer Vielzahl an Möglichkeiten, um Deine Herzensthemen voranzutreiben. Willst auch Du gemeinsam mit uns wachsen? Dann werde Teil von Wavestone als (Senior) Consultant SAP BI & Analytics.




Deine Aufgaben




Als festes Projektmitglied unterstützt Du unsere Kunden in den Bereichen Data Strategy, Data Architecture, Data Intelligence, Big Data, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für kleinere Projekte und bist für die Konzeption und Umsetzung von datengetriebenen SAP Anwendungen verantwortlich
Du bist sowohl intern als auch extern beim Kunden Ansprechpartner:in für Data-Intelligence-Themen im Allgemeinen und SAP-Themen im Speziellen
Du führst neue Kolleg:innen in die Themen Data Intelligence, Data Analytics, Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence ein
Du unterstützt Deine:n Manager:in bei der Weiterentwicklung des Data Intelligence Portfolios
Du arbeitest bei der Erstellung und Präsentation von Angeboten mit




Dein Profil




Du verfügst über erste Projekterfahrung im SAP BI Frontend und/oder Backend
Dabei konntest Du Dich bereits als (Teil-) Projektleiter:in beweisen
Du bringst sehr gute Kenntnisse im Anforderungsmanagement für datengetriebene Lösungen mit
Du begeisterst Dich für innovative Data-Intelligence-Themen im SAP-Umfeld und hast Dich idealerweise bereits mit SAP BW on HANA, SAP BW/4HANA, HANA native, XS Advanced, S/4HANA Embedded Analytics, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Analysis for Office (AfO) oder SQL-Scripting auseinandergesetzt
Du zeichnest Dich durch sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten aus
Du hast Spass am Networking und ein enger Austausch mit Deinen Kunden ist dir wichtig
Stilsichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Deine Benefits




Your career, your way: Unser Personal Growth Model und Coaching & Leading-Ansatz bieten Dir eine enge, vollumfängliche Unterstützung sowohl in Deiner langfristigen Entwicklung als auch im Daily Business. In unserer Academy findest Du ein breites Weiterbildungsangebot wie Sprach- und Zertifizierungskurse, individuelles Coaching oder gezielte Trainings für Führungskräfte. Und durch unser flexibles Karrieremodell sowie unseren Fluid Company Ansatz entscheidest Du selbst, wo und wie schnell es für Dich weiter geht.
Karriere & Privatleben: Für eine gute Balance versuchen wir, alle unsere Stellen möglichst auch in Teilzeit anzubieten. Dank Mobile Work Policy arbeitest Du bequem von zuhause oder in einem unserer Schweizer Büros. Mit „Mobile Work Abroad“ kannst Du bis zu 50 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland (sowie UK, NOR, ISL, LIE) arbeiten, wenn Dein:e Kund:in Dich nicht vor Ort braucht. Des Weiteren gibt es 25 Tage Ferien, zusätzliche Ferientage bei besonderen familiären Umständen oder einem beruflich bedingten Umzug sowie verschiedene Sabbatical-Optionen.
Mobilität nach Mass: Dank eines festen monatlichen Mobilitätsbudgets bist Du bei uns flexibel und umweltbewusst unterwegs: egal, ob privat oder beruflich, und mit einem klaren Fokus auf nachhaltige Verkehrsmittel.
Wert-volle Unternehmenskultur: Unsere Werte verantwortungsbewusst, energiegeladen und gemeinsam sind zentrale Bestandteile unseres Alltags. Das spürst Du z. B. bei unseren Powerdays, bei denen Du Dich gemeinnützig engagieren kannst. In Netzwerken, wie dem Women’s Network oder unserer Mindfulness Gilde. Durch regelmässige Befragungen unserer Mitarbeitenden über Great Place To Work. Bei unseren einmaligen Events, firmeninternen Fitnessgruppen und vielem mehr.
Faire Vergütung: Wir bieten faire und attraktive Gehälter, bestehend aus einem fixen und einem leistungsbasierten Anteil. Im Falle von Mutterschutz gewähren wir dabei den vollen, leistungsbasierten Anteil. Zudem gleichen wir unsere Gehälter regelmässig über externe Benchmark Studien mit dem Markt ab – immer auch mit Blick auf Gender Equal Pay.
Show more

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform’s scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Show more

Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Business Analyst/ Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making. 

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

How You Can Make An Impact


Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent



What We Are Looking For:

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently



Consulting and Communication Skills:


Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops



Technical Expertise:


Strong Engineering and/or Mathematics background
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

  • We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.


Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Title: Analista Júnior de Dados - Prevenção à Fraude
HTML:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor. Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Qual será a sua missão

Estamos buscando uma (a) analista júnior de dados para apoiar a tomada de decisões relacionadas às iniciativas de prevenção à fraudes. Com a orientação do gestor, esse profissional ajudará a propor abordagens criativas, buscar dados e interpretar informações estatísticas para responder questões complexas e gerar insumos importantes para as discussões do time.

Job Description

Como será o seu dia a dia

  • Estruturar e conduzir análises de dados para apoiar a construção de novas regras e modelos de fraude ou propor mudanças nas regras e modelos existentes;
  • Construir análises de impacto para justificar a implementação de novas funcionalidades que possam melhorar nossas defesas contra fraude;
  • Estruturar, construir e manter dashboards para acompanhar ativamente as perdas por fraude e identificar riscos potenciais;
  • Apoiar o gerente na criação de apresentações impactantes para comunicar efetivamente as principais descobertas dentro de seu escopo;
  • Buscar outras equipes (dentro ou fora da equipe de Prevenção à Fraude) para obter as melhores práticas relacionadas à análise de dados e pedir apoio quando necessário;
  • Apoiar outras equipes da Shopee fornecendo informações, conduzindo análises e resolvendo problemas pontuais que estejam dentro de seu escopo de trabalho;
  • Ajudar na criação de metas para fraude no marketplace, monitorar indicadores e enviar alertas quando necessário (por exemplo, para mudar prioridades visando alcance de metas);
  • Realizar estudos de benchmarking externos para reunir as melhores práticas relacionadas à Análise de Dados na Prevenção à Fraude.

Requirements

O que você precisa para assumir o desafio

  • Formação em andamento ou completa em cursos de Engenharia, Ciências da Computação, Administração de Empresas ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Conhecimento intermediário no Pacote Office, principalmente Excel/Sheets;
  • Conhecimento avançado em SQL (Experiência em outras linguagens de programação é um diferencial)
  • Experiência em Prevenção de Fraude é um diferencial;
  • Inglês avançado (será testado durante o processo de seleção).

Benefícios

  • Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes;
  • Parceira com Wellhub (Gympass) e TotalPass;
  • Vale Refeição/Alimentação flexível;
  • Vale Transporte ou, Vale Mobilidade;
  • Benefício flexível;
  • Parceria com o app Zenklub;
  • Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.

VEM FAZER HISTÓRIA COM A GENTE.

O QUE TE FAZ ÚNICO, NOS FAZ MELHORES!

Title: Analista de Dados
HTML:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Qual será a sua missão

A posição de Analista de Projetos e Operações é responsável por entender oportunidades de melhorias operacionais dentro de projetos, entendendo em colaboração com áreas de Produtos, Logística e de Business quais os pontos chave necessários para o sucesso de cada projeto, criando e acompanhando indicadores, levantando oportunidades de melhoria sistêmicas através de análises de dados e de experiência.

Job Description

Como será o seu dia a dia

  • Mapeamento de gaps e análises de melhorias;
  • Gestão de projetos junto às áreas internas e externas;
  • Análise de dados para identificação de oportunidades e problemas;
  • Elaboração de dashboards e relatórios;
  • Elaboração e apresentação de propostas de melhorias em fóruns internos;
  • Gestão de stakeholders.

Requirements

O que você precisa para assumir o desafio

  • Graduação completa em Administração, Logística, Engenharia ou áreas correlatas;
  • Conhecimento no Pacote Office (word, excel, powerpoint), principalmente Excel/ Google Sheets;
  • Forte pensamento lógico e analítico, organização;
  • Experiência em mapeamento e melhoria de processos operacionais e gerenciamento de projetos;
  • Mandatório conhecimento em SQL;
  • Desejável experiência em gestão de processos e/ou operações.
  • Disponibilidade para atuar no formato híbrido (presencial 3x por semana na região da Faria Lima/SP).

Benefícios

  • Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes;
  • Parceira com Gympass e TotalPass;
  • Vale Refeição/Alimentação flexível;
  • Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local;
  • Benefício flexível;
  • Zenklub.

VEM FAZER HISTÓRIA COM A GENTE.

O QUE TE FAZ ÚNICO, NOS FAZ MELHORES! 🧡

Description:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Modelo de trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Garantir a correta análise e registro de ocorrências, o monitoramento de indicadores e o acompanhamento das iniciativas de prevenção de

perdas, contribuindo para a redução de riscos e a melhoria contínua dos processos operacionais.

Registrar e analisar ocorrências internas, elaborando relatórios e atualizando os indicadores da área.

Apoiar a equipe operacional levantando informações de possíveis problemas.
Acompanhar reuniões e registrar os principais pontos discutidos.
Monitorar e documentar o andamento de iniciativas voltadas para a prevenção de perdas.
Auxiliar no desenvolvimento e acompanhamento de KPIs relacionados à prevenção de perdas.
Identificar padrões nos dados e apoiar a equipe na sugestão de melhorias para reduzir riscos.

Ensino Superior completo em administração, logística ou áreas correlatas.

Desejável conhecimento em ferramentas como sql.
